ratings.comment: Not the easiest class, but a good professor. I enjoy his classes and know that this semester Ive learned a lot. Would recommend any of Robbs courses.

I really enjoyed Cliff for CS627 and thought the class was great and well structured. However, for CS675 I feel much differently. It is confusing and the lectures he does aren't very constructive. We have to do a group project each week and the instructions aren't clear and if you don't have previous education on the topic you won't understand it.

Cliff is awesome! He found a way to make learning about stocks and bonds really fun and fascinating. He sparked my interest in the subject and made me excited to learn. The textbook is necessary because he glosses over things sometimes, however, he is always happy to help and answer questions. He also provides good review before each exam

The professor tries to make lecture enjoyable even with boring topics but its still super boring. The TA is unwilling to provide constructive advice over email on solving problems, hes very vague. The curves are nice. The investment project is really tough bc there's questions about things we didn't learn. took me hours. study hard for this class

Best professor Ive had at UW. Would definitely take again. Lots of lectures but he is engaging and I actually enjoyed them. He can be tough but he is really quite fair-you just have to actually do your work.

Cliff is a great professor, especially for this course. His powerpoints give you a good outline of what is on the tests, but you need to be in person to get further information. He is very helpful if you are having a tough time and need more help. Overall difficult concepts, but if you work hard you should be able to get at least a B.

Cliff is a genuinely good guy, but has trouble conveying the information to students in a meaningful or understandable way. We had 3 tests throughout the semester and no final. There was homework due every other week and 2 projects. I would prefer to take a different instructor if given the choice.
